Docs.summary: Specifies the button style within a toolbar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by members such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Style%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The toolbar button appearance is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.Appearance%2A> property of the toolbar. Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.Appearance%2A> property to `Flat` will give the toolbar and its buttons a flat appearance. As the mouse pointer moves over the buttons, they take on a three-dimensional appearance. Also, when the toolbar has a flat appearance, button separators appear as a line rather than as a space between the buttons.
## Examples The following example instantiates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> and three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls, assigns the buttons to the toolbar, and sets some of the buttons' common properties. This code assumes a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MenuItem>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> have been instantiated and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> has at least one <xref:System.Drawing.Image> assigned to it.
